comments.raw_text:
If I shift-reply to an email with long source lines, and "hand" wrap the text, it's confusing (sometimes adding "> " a the front of a split line causes the entire line to move to the next line.  Pasting in "> " works, but you end up with "change bars" above, and "> whatever" for most subsequent lines.  In source, it appears that pasting added a space before the '>'.  Probably on purpose...

This is hugely confusing.

I do this because otherwise replying is painful with huge lines, and reading the reply is painful.  Something to (re)wrap text optionally or by default would help tremendously.
